lender.name: Kirsten
lender.loan_because: I am so impressed with the people in other countries. They waste so little & work so hard.

lender.name: Tom and Lin
lender.loan_because: giving is the best reward of all!

lender.name: Gabi & David
lender.loan_because: it's easy to make a big difference in someone's life.

lender.name: Shane
lender.loan_because: I want to find a sustainable solution to international poverty

lender.name: Flippin Family
lender.loan_because: "To whom much is given, much is required."
lender.occupational_info: We are nurses caring for the physical needs of the ill.

lender.name: Anne
lender.loan_because: I believe in the power of small businesses, entrepreneurs and well thought out dreams.

lender.name: Andy
lender.loan_because: I want to give back some of the good fortune I have had.
lender.occupational_info: I help people who have been injured.

lender.name: fred
lender.loan_because: I've got the money, they need the help.
lender.occupational_info: Public school music teacher

lender.name: Emily
lender.loan_because: I don't make a high salary for my area of the US, but I know that, compared to most people around the world, I am rich. I'm interested to see what a small amount of money (from my perspective) could do for a motivated individual to whom it's a great deal of money.
lender.occupational_info: I work with a small group of people creating computer software which helps groups of people work together to accomplish their goals and projects.

lender.name: Rod
lender.loan_because: I've been given so much in my life.

lender.name: North Ryde Dentist
lender.loan_because: we all want to make a gentle difference all over the world.
lender.occupational_info: we look after the dental needs of our patients in sydney, australia.

lender.name: Lee
lender.loan_because: To be of service and to help people.
lender.occupational_info: I make media, content and apps to help people collaborate.

lender.name: Henrik
lender.loan_because: I believe in personally supporting small entrepreneurs.

lender.name: Samira
lender.loan_because: I believe everyone deserves a chance - paying it forward allows God to continue doing great work in our lives, it teaches your kids to share and be greatful for what we have, because we are all brothers and sisters in this world...because tomorrow it may be you.
lender.occupational_info: I work mainly in marketing, my tittle of project manager (traffic manager in most places) ones act a liason with the copy writer, art director, production, studio to make something happen..this something can be an ad, or a direct mail piece, point of purchase...which ever it is, I help manage these components so they can come together within an specific timeline...time is very sensitive in this industry, especially if your client has bought media space, this being newspaper, magazine, billboard etc.

lender.name: Susan
lender.occupation: ~ making our world a better place ~
lender.loan_because: I can. I am fortunate to have more than I need.
lender.occupational_info: I answer the calls of those in need and I send those that can help.

lender.name: Jerry
lender.loan_because: I'm not much of a business person but if someone can make use of some of my money then great!
lender.occupational_info:
I carve local wood and stone in conjunction with the material. see my work at jerryvasconcellossculpture.com
http://s12.photobucket.com/albums/a244/jvasco/?start=all

lender.name: zung
lender.loan_because: i can

lender.name: Martin
lender.loan_because: I can help people
lender.occupational_info: I work with economics in the local city administration

lender.name: Ed and Amy
lender.loan_because: We are christians, helping others is what we are supposed to do. And we enjoy it.
lender.occupational_info: We dispense medications, provide care for mothers/babies and offer medical advice to patients who come to the pharmacy/hospital.

lender.name: Sandy and Ed
lender.loan_because: This is a great way to "pay it forward" for all of our blessings. Helping other people with starting or expanding their business is like teaching them to fish. We've been looking for something like this for a long time.

lender.name: Kevin & Wendy
lender.loan_because: We want to do what we can to help make the world a better place, and we're impressed with the entrepreneurial spirit of these people.

lender.name: Tommie
lender.loan_because: God has blessed me over and over and I feel the need to help others gain self respect and a feeling of worth. Those that have should give and give without expecting anything in return. God said we are to take care of the less fortunate and the poor. My blessings are to be shared with others so we all have enough.
lender.occupational_info: I am sort of retired from working full time but enjoy working part time helping others sell commercial insurance products to businesses.

lender.name: Graham
lender.loan_because: My money does more good through a Kiva loan than it would do if I spent it in the UK.
lender.occupational_info: I work with computers, making tools to help people design electronics chips.

lender.name: anthony
lender.loan_because: I would like to help someone who may have not had the opportunities I have had in my life.
lender.occupational_info: I teach piano and perform in groups around the country, and play many types of music, mainly classical.

lender.name: Michiel
lender.loan_because: Lending trough Kiva offers a great way of helping those who need it most in a way that I feel definitely works. It's not just transferring money to a bank account but you're making a true investment that pays off in many ways.

lender.name: George
lender.loan_because: I have some extra money and I would like to support other people with it.
lender.occupational_info: I keep records of cancer cases in Detroit, Michigan to help doctors and researchers who treat and study cancer.

lender.name: Susan
lender.loan_because: "Give a man a fish; you have fed him for today. Teach a man to fish; and you have fed him for a lifetime." The next step after teaching is to equip him to fish.
lender.occupational_info: I teach adults.

lender.name: Rene
lender.loan_because: I believe there is more than one way to save the world...
lender.occupational_info: I investigate and keep track of infectious diseases, making sure they are under control and do not affect too many people too fast.

lender.name: Theodore
lender.loan_because: I believe in the ability of people throughout the world to create a better life for themselves and their families with just a little help from those who have a bit more of this world goods.
lender.occupational_info: I do clinical research in the areas of substance use disorder and violence.

lender.name: Scot
lender.loan_because: The aim of life is to live, and to live means to be aware...joyously, drunkenly, serenely, divinely aware.

lender.name: Darren
lender.loan_because: It makes a difference.
lender.occupational_info: I help companies to become profitable.

lender.name: Carol
lender.loan_because: I started my business over 30 years ago with $1200, a credit card and the encouragement of a mentor. I had to be in profit enough to live on my earnings the first month. While I am not wealthy, I have enough....and so much more than many others. I learned about microeconomic loans years ago and fell in love with the idea....especially since many such loans help women gain greater autonomy and confidence from running their own businesses. This is a tangible way that I can honor those who helped me by helping others.... May our lendees enjoy the rewards (and struggles) of small business ownership and may people reaching out to people in some way bring more 'heart' back into a world that has become increasingly dominated by large corporations. I have traveled a fair amount in other parts of the world and we humans seem to have the same hopes, fears, dreams, loves and heartbreaks the world over. It is the love and spirit that I can still see in the eyes and feel in the hearts of "poor" people in so-called Third World countries that renews my soul and reminds me what is really important.
lender.occupational_info: Mostly I rub the kinks and knots in people's tight neck, back and shoulder muscles and listen to an endless stream of the little (usually VERY little) and big problems of my clients.

lender.name: John
lender.loan_because: Giving to those who are working hard is right. They need it, and deserve it. God bless!
lender.occupational_info: I am a student. I'm currently studying and working to be an entrepreneur myself.

lender.name: Ann & Bill
lender.loan_because: We recognize that, as a family, we've been blessed. Doing this little bit to help hardworking people help themselves seems the least we can do.
lender.occupational_info: Ann is perpetually busy taking care of our home and 2 daughters. Bill is an Obstetrician/Gynecologist - involved in women's health care.

lender.name: Nishant
lender.loan_because: I want to help sustain the livelihoods of those in need without them having to compromise their dignity.

lender.name: Anna&Olly
lender.loan_because: there isn't a reason I can think of not to.
lender.occupational_info: Olly is 6 years old and he likes trains, MƒÅori carvings, Spongebob and playing with his kitten Twinkle. Anna is somewhat older. She is training to be a teacher.

lender.name: Sky
lender.occupation: Certified Massage Therapist and Life Coach
lender.loan_because: I want to give back
lender.occupational_info: I help people through transitions, which can be anything from career to relationship. I love working with women entrepreneurs, help find what it is they truly desire and help them focus on their goal. And I am also a bodyworker and energy healer.

lender.name: Danny & Veronica
lender.loan_because: Even though we are not rich, we feel it is important to help those less fortunate, so we want to help those who want to help themselves.

lender.name: Adrian
lender.loan_because: it's the right thing to do.

lender.name: Kevin
lender.loan_because: it helps people and it makes me feel happy.
lender.occupational_info: I work at a university designing and managing construction projects.

lender.name: David
lender.loan_because: I can.
lender.occupational_info: I work with children of different abilities.

lender.name: Nick
lender.loan_because: Everybody deserves an opportunity
lender.occupational_info: I am studying business and international affairs

lender.name: Diana
lender.loan_because: I would like to use the money in five years to adopt a girl from china but right now the money can help someone else.
lender.occupational_info: I take classes, tutor, and teach.

lender.name: Corlett Family
lender.loan_because: this is a great idea and we like to help others!
lender.occupational_info: I add my voice to animated cartoons, radio & TV shows and commercials. I also write and create childrens TV shows.

lender.name: Doug
lender.loan_because: I invest with entrepreneurs who specialize in mobile communication devices and computer services. Global communication technology lets us become business partners. Let us build prosperity --- together!

lender.name: Keith
lender.loan_because: I am a Christian.
lender.occupational_info: I sell airplane parts to airlines.

lender.name: Richy Li
lender.loan_because: Helping others around the world is good. I have been helping others by different ways, volunteering, donating or teaching, but lending as a social investor is very new to me.
lender.occupational_info: Creative fundraising with internet

lender.name: Karan
lender.loan_because: I like the concept of a 'loan'. I think it allows people to get help they need without losing their self respect in the process.
lender.occupational_info: I manage teams that write computer programs to help run businesses more efficiently.

lender.name: Bobby
lender.loan_because: Because I can.... after many years of hard work I have established myself as a working professional. It took a a helping hand to reach my goals and now I am grateful that I can help someone else reach theirs.
lender.occupational_info: Map Maker

lender.name: Sandy
lender.occupational_info: hella stressful!

lender.name: Mariel
lender.loan_because: I love the feeling of being able to help someone with their business, preserve their pride, and exercise great financial responsibility. I applaud all the small business owners all over the world who strive to make honest, successful livelihoods.
lender.occupational_info: I am a college student at the Haas School of Business at UC Berkeley studying Business Management.

lender.name: Pedro
lender.loan_because: On my trips to other countries I have always been welcomed warm-heartedly. Lending money to local start-ups is just a little effort for us in the "developed countries", but it can change a life for the beneficiary of the loan and their families.

lender.name: matt and gail
lender.loan_because: We can and we should...

lender.name: Monsur
lender.loan_because: it could make someone capable to help others in turn.

lender.name: Vanessa
lender.loan_because: To help people to achieve thier dream.
lender.occupational_info: Love to cook for other people, and some day hope to have my own restaurant or teach other people to cook.

lender.name: mohammad reza
lender.loan_because: i am going to set up a business in russia and need almost 5000 usd -10000 usd loan amount to begin.
lender.occupational_info: i am a business consultant and an expert of forex and wish to set up a forex company in moscow.

lender.name: NELLO
lender.loan_because: To provide opportunities to those that less fortunate, but honest and hardworking people.
lender.occupational_info: I am course manager for the US Army Aviaion maintenance training.

lender.name: Turner Family
lender.loan_because: Teaching our 15 year old the importance of being a positive influence in a very small world

lender.name: lori
lender.loan_because: To give back to the wonderful people of Mexico

lender.name: Bruce and Ruth
lender.loan_because: Others have given us a helping hand, so we offer one in return.
lender.occupational_info: I recommend solutions to allow disabled farmers to continue farming.

lender.name: Cheri
lender.loan_because: I'm lucky enough to be able to do it.

lender.name: Terrence
lender.loan_because: It is a way of helping someone who you know by name. Lending builds capacity in others rather than just sustaining them.

lender.name: Tom
lender.loan_because: I can.

lender.name: Todd
lender.loan_because: People who work hard and have plans to better their family's life, deserve the communal capital to help them achieve their goals.
lender.occupational_info: I help people learn how to do three things. First, observe relations between individuals, groups, and organizations. Second, how to explain what they find. Third, how to use that learning to actively improve their world.

lender.name: Eric & Vivian
lender.loan_because: We're very blessed to be in the position that we're in and there are many who are not as fortunate.
lender.occupational_info: Software Engineering consultant and international flight attendant.

lender.name: Pierre
lender.loan_because: I think it is an efficient way to help people out.
lender.occupational_info: I help people to improve their business.

lender.name: Hunter & Teresa
lender.loan_because: we want to help give others an opportunity to succeed.

lender.name: R & K
lender.loan_because: We know that such a small outreach can make a huge difference.

lender.name: Rose
lender.loan_because: it connects me to the world
lender.occupational_info: banking operations

lender.name: Nathan
lender.occupation: Grad Student and Real Estate Agent
lender.loan_because:
John 13: 34-35
Do what you can, with what you have, where you are. -Theodore Roosevelt

lender.name: Ina
lender.loan_because: Because I can. It makes me connected. Thank you Kiva for making this possible.

lender.name: Christopher
lender.loan_because: "Globalization" is not just about multinational corporations. It's about recognizing that what happens in Africa affects those of us in the US and in all the developed countries. I was lucky enough to end up in a good family in the wealthiest nation in the world. The true entrepreneurs are those that Kiva supports.
lender.occupational_info: One of the great things about the U.S. is our civil justice system. When someone is hurt at the expense of a big company that individual can walk into a court house and know that she is going to get a fair trial. I represent people who are taking on those big companies. I like to think that part of the reason that they can get a fair trial is that there are trial lawyers in this country who are ready, willing and able to stand in a court and fight for justice, no matter how much money someone has.

lender.name: Killis
lender.loan_because: I have done some traveling and seen how hard people work to supply their family with the basics of life. Sometimes it requires a mentor, a family member or a stranger from far away to make a commitment to help. People with jobs, family and a loan at the bank make better citizens of the world.
lender.occupational_info: I have a gift of understanding old buildings and how to rebuild them with new activities inside. Many of my projects are old theatres that we restore and create wonderful spaces for the performers to show their skills to patrons that enjoy their performances. I help to bring education and joy into other people's lives.

lender.name: Karen
lender.loan_because: I want to help people help themselves because I believe this is the best way to eradicate poverty in the world.
lender.occupational_info: I create and use computerised information to generate maps for decision making using Geographic Information Systems.

lender.name: Cari
lender.loan_because: I am fortunate to not have to worry about food, housing, or anything else that money can buy. Money is a tool which can help others, and since I can't go to their homes and help them build or dig a new well, it's the best I can do for my fellow travellers on this planet.
lender.occupational_info: I don't - I'm retired.

lender.name: Daniel W
lender.loan_because: It is extremely important to me to help others in any way I can.

lender.name: irina
lender.loan_because: $s don't do much good sitting around

lender.name: Laura
lender.loan_because: I believe good business can correct what bad business has done to the developing world...
lender.occupational_info: I worked as a Kiva Fellow at Vision Finance Company in Kigali, Rwanda. Now I'm in strategy consulting at McKinsey & Co.

lender.name: Julie-Alexander-Michael
lender.loan_because: I like to help people who are willing to do something to help themselves.

lender.name: Amy
lender.loan_because:
Loaning changes lives in big ways. It amazes me to think that I can give even small amounts and encourage hard working people in a practical way. I am thrilled to be able to take part in this and can't wait to be able to do more.
"The greatest good you can do for another is not just to share your riches, but to reveal to him his own." Benjamin Disraeli 1804-1881, Former British Prime Minister
lender.occupational_info: I create illustrations and fine art for books and magazines. My focus is on children's illustration, but I also create pen and ink renderings of homes, inns and houses for businesses. I enjoy creating portraits as well.

lender.name: Lorenz
lender.loan_because: I believe

lender.name: Steve
lender.loan_because: I am attempting to spin the world back towards the positive direction. There are a lot of bad things happening, and I would like to counteract them.
lender.occupational_info: I am a programmer and a scientist. I enjoy working with high technology to hopefully find out what's really going on, and how to help the world's problems.

lender.name: Mark
lender.loan_because: I want to share the grace, mercy and hope of Christ with my friends around the world.
lender.occupational_info: Business Manager

lender.name: John
lender.loan_because: ...love thy neighbor.

lender.name: Ashvin
lender.loan_because: I'd like to see this project succeed and prove the skeptics wrong.
lender.occupational_info: I work on combining computers and imaging equipment in new and useful ways for doctors.

lender.name: Kristen
lender.loan_because: I know what it is like to want to achieve.
lender.occupational_info: I work for a small credit union. I make sure we are doing everything according to the laws of the state and US government. I also assist the Board of Directors by being a secretary to them.

lender.name: Charles
lender.loan_because: I'm not rich by U.S. standards but I certainly am in relation to most of the world's people. To whom much is given, much is expected.

lender.name: Ryan
lender.loan_because: I like to help those less fortunate achieve their goals and hopefully assist them on their way to fulfilling their dreams
lender.occupational_info: I am a Engineering student as well as work designing airplanes

lender.name: Don & Peg
lender.loan_because:
Throughout their lives Don and Peg loaned money to struggling micro-entrepreneurs often enough to stretch their own household budget past the comfort zone. They did this in the Salinas Valley from the 1960s to the 1980s long before micro-finance emerged as an accepted way to promote development and fight poverty.
This account is funded by Don and Peg's money and contributions from their family and friends as a living and life-enhancing memorial.
Don and Peg's fund loans to only a few places. Mexico where they spent the happiest 15 years of their lives. The island of Hispanola, especially Haiti which made a profound impression on them during the summer of 1982. Samoa in the South Pacific because of Don's experiences there in WWII. And finally, Nicaragua because Don and Peg's grandsons are establishing ties of service and business in that country.
lender.occupational_info:
Along the way Don worked as a carpenter, a machinist mate, a metals fabricator, and a teacher. He found an avid vocation cooking for his family and for the homeless of Salinas, CA during the 1970s and 1980s.
Peg was an industrial seamstress, assembly line worker, mother, homemaker, writer, teacher, community activist and through it all an voracious reader.
Don and Peg were married for 58 years. All families have leavers and stayers. Don and Peg were always leavers. They left the coalfields of southern Illinois for St. Louis after WW2. In the early 1950s John Steinbeck's "Mother Road" beckoned and they followed old Route 66 all the way to the Santa Monica pier. Leaving LA five years later to settle in Salinas, CA where they would raise their children before leaving again. In retirement they followed the coast south to Ensenada, Mexico and settled into a small adobe house to live out the remaining good years of their lives among many new friends.
Don left for good in June 2005 with Peg following soon after in November 2007.

lender.name: Lygia
lender.loan_because: I'm grateful for the support and opportunities that I've had throughout my life, and I want to give back to those in need of a hand.

lender.name: Rob
lender.loan_because: I believe that access to capital is the greatest barrier to sustainable economic growth in underdeveloped markets. Responsible investment increases opportunity and leads to a healthier, more equitable, and better planet.
lender.occupational_info: Trade and project finance to emerging markets, especially Africa. Developing a stronger project architecture to reduce risk and ensure long-term success.

lender.name: Giorgio
lender.loan_because: I admire people who keep going on despite terrible situations.
lender.occupational_info: I facilitate great teachers to become available to a large audience.

lender.name: SPM
lender.loan_because: Our Catholic faith urges that we help the struggling, the poor, those in war-torn countries or refugees and widows and orphans. It seems like Kiva is a good solid organization too, with maximum benefit being passed on to the loan recipients. Also all of us who can read this on a computer had a hand up from a teacher, a mentor or parents or friends or relatives; so why not give a hand up to another person and pass on your blessings, not to mention it feels wonderful to be able to give a hand up to someone!
lender.occupational_info: I write about financial markets.

lender.name: Bruce
lender.loan_because: I get great satisfaction out of helping others help themselves.
lender.occupational_info: I help people solve problems, manage projects and achieve their goals.

lender.name: Stuart
lender.loan_because: I have been lucky and have the ability to help others achieve their dreams
lender.occupational_info: I am the Managing Partner of an accounting firm in New York

lender.name: Anna
lender.loan_because: it blesses someone else
lender.occupational_info: freelancing graphic designer specializing in branding and corporate identity

lender.name: Jessica
lender.loan_because: I can help other people reach dreams that I haven't started to think about yet.

lender.name: Carla S.
lender.loan_because: This promotes successful small businesses, and ultimately, we hope,a healthy economy in developing countries.
lender.occupational_info: fine artist and teacher

lender.name: Frank
lender.loan_because: I can use the same money over and over again to do good deeds.
lender.occupational_info: I fix computers.

lender.name: Victor
lender.loan_because: I believe in Selfless Service

lender.name: Marcelo e Flavia
lender.loan_because: 1. It can end poverty. 2. Because I can. 3. Because it is needed. 4. Because everyone deserves a chance. Thank's Leo Ferreira

lender.name: Lea
lender.loan_because: everyone deserves to thrive and prosper. By helping others, I help myself. We all live in this world together.

lender.name: Jane
lender.loan_because:
Folks have helped me, and now it is time to give back. It is a good way to move the world ahead, and help us all be partners, be friends. It shows we care about each other and have the same wishes and needs, more in common than differences.
Today on the anniversary of 9-11, as a witness to the events that day in NYC I am moved again to reach out to the good people of the world in the hopes that a ripple effect will continue, one small step. I hope that my gut instincts are correct.

lender.name: Alison
lender.loan_because: Everyone should have the opportunity to create a better life for themselves.

lender.name: brigitte
lender.loan_because: it may make a difference, and have a ripple effect.

lender.name: John
lender.loan_because: I like to help out people in need. And since the request is paid back I feel this is the right thing to do.
lender.occupational_info: I own a Travel Agency.

lender.name: chiara
lender.loan_because: i believe in trying to make the world a little more fair than it currently is
lender.occupational_info: i work part time in a bookstore, but most of my life revolves around gardening, cooking, my dog, husband and living life.

lender.name: Liane
lender.loan_because: I want to do all I can to lift people out of poverty and give them a chance at self-sufficiency.
lender.occupational_info: I teach rhetoric--academic reading and writing-- to college freshmen at San Diego State University.

lender.name: Pat and Becky
lender.loan_because: To share the abundance of life.

lender.name: Steve and Araceli
lender.loan_because: I love the entrepenural spirit in people. Give a person a seed to plant and they will become a farmer.
lender.occupational_info: fixing telecommunications equipment. developing new telecommunications inventions

lender.name: Leslie
lender.loan_because: Since working in Guatamala in Small Business Development with the Peace Corps, I know how hard people in the third world work and how much even a little help can mean. Kiva is a wonderful way to give and to see directly where your money is going. People to people for a better world.
lender.occupational_info: I work for a land trust which helps property owners ensure that their land will remain in agriculture or forest or riparian habitat in perpetuity.

lender.name: Ryan
lender.loan_because: I care about the people!

lender.name: Al and Val
lender.loan_because: We have so much to be thankful for and would like to share our blessings with others. We hope that the "seeds" that we plant here will grow into strong and successful experiences for these amazing entrepreneurs, and in turn, their communities.

lender.name: Phillip
lender.loan_because: It's a great way to help people and encourage development in less fortunate nations.

lender.name: scchiang
lender.loan_because: I have the ability to help others in need.

lender.name: Matthew
lender.loan_because: I need to borrow money for school. People outside of America are sort of in a similar situation but have less oportunities than me, and I have some extra money to spread the USA feeling.

lender.name: Tinkie
lender.loan_because: Why not? It is a good idea and if it works, the better!
lender.occupational_info: working in a non-profit organisation as director.

lender.name: Alyssa
lender.loan_because: Everybody needs a chance to make a difference in the world.

lender.name: Gregory
lender.loan_because: Kiva is the easiest way to do the right thing , and make a difference in this world.
lender.occupational_info: Simi retired, I still work Urgent Care clinics for Indian Health Services, and Kaiser.

lender.name: Brian
lender.loan_because: "Goodness is the only investment that never fails" - Henry David Thoreau

lender.name: Chris
lender.loan_because: I have tried to raise money for projects myself, I know the difficulties of getting people to listen! I think Kiva represents a brilliant idea to help me to help others & change lives for the better.
lender.occupational_info: I teach English as a foreign or second language. As well as this I have several other projects on the go....

lender.name: Mathson School
lender.loan_because: It's wonderful to learn more about the people of the world.
lender.occupational_info: My students enjoy learning about the many people in our world. We're thinking about you and wishing you success!

lender.name: Trevor
lender.loan_because: In serving each other we become free.

lender.name: Neel
lender.loan_because: why not?

lender.name: Nathaniel
lender.loan_because: It's just one way we can help bridge the enormous gap between socio-economic levels on a global scale.
lender.occupational_info:
I work for an international affairs graduate school.
I'm a former Peace Corps volunteer seeking ways to keep my Global Citizen card.

lender.name: Avani Parekh-Bhatt
lender.loan_because: I've seen microloans make a difference, and I believe in paying it forward.
lender.occupational_info: I raise money for community based financial institutions, many of which make microloans to low income families in my state. Also a Kiva fellow in KF9, in Nairobi, Kenya with SMEP!

lender.name: Dieter and Kimberley
lender.loan_because: You have a business plan, but limited access to finance. We have been lucky to find support when we needed it - we hope to pass that on. What goes around....comes around......
lender.occupational_info: GM and Lecturer

lender.name: The Stokes
lender.loan_because: Extensive travel to Third World Countries has given me some insight into the much needed assistance to keep a business profitable and sustainable.
lender.occupational_info: I work at Pittsburgh International Airport and my wife is a Social Studies teacher at a Catholic school. I also photograph and document artifacts in the Anthropology annex of the Carnegie Natural History Museum. We have a 6 year old daughter and a 6 year old beagle.

lender.name: Scott
lender.loan_because: I admire these entrepreneurs and love the work tht Kiva is doing, so I just want to help in my own small way.

lender.name: MainStreet
lender.loan_because: In the USA, MainStreet Lender works to advance small businesses every day. We provide government guaranteed and conventional loans to small business owners nationwide. But through Kiva, we also strive to provide opportunity to small business owners throughout the world. We believe small business and entrepreneurs is the best way to provide independence and opportunity, and create prosperity.
lender.occupational_info: We are a commercial non-bank lender, and we provide loans for the purchase or refinance of businesses and real estate to a variety of small enterprises in industries such as hospitality, medical, automotive, retail, and manufacturing.

lender.name: Drew
lender.loan_because: a small loan from me can make a significant difference in someone's life.

This is the best way to help each other around the world, stimulate enthousiastic people with energy.

lender.loan_because:
There is no reason on this earth that people should have to struggle to get by day by day, we all have so very much.
I do this so that others can make a difference for themselves.

lender.name: James
lender.loan_because: To help someone potentially change their life and generation.
lender.occupational_info: I teach managers to be better managers.

lender.name: for Krista
lender.loan_because: My younger sister has Downs' Syndrome and cannot work outside the home. She is thrilled that I can take some of my earnings and lend some money on her behalf to hard-working women in Asia to help them to improve their lives and those of their families.

lender.name: Amanda
lender.loan_because: it is needed.

lender.name: Rhonda
lender.loan_because: I believe that if each person that is able to lend bands together with other like-minded people, we can make a huge difference in the world's economy and in the lives of those that are willing to work hard to pull themselves up by the bootstraps. I have been in business for myself and I know what a difficult task it is to go from dreaming to successful business-owner.

lender.name: Lova
lender.loan_because: Being a broke 24 years old economics student, I'm starting a new internet business called blogadollar.com . It will be a FREE ressource for anyone wanting to start his/her own home-based business and website. The problem with websites is they're hard to promote and get new visitors and traffic to. That is the lifeblood of a website and many many people fail and continue to fail at driving traffic to their website. Blogadollar.com is my 24 old student brain's product, it's a new web 2.0 generation blog, I try to bring a huge value to the self little guys entrepreneurs via blogadollar.com, by working hard to give them what they so desperatly want, "Step by Step info about driving swarm of traffic to their blog/website" and finally make it successful and popular. To do that, I intend to and already work very hard on researching a lot of info about how to drive targeted traffic to one's website, sort the info, pull out only what is proven to work and praised by REAL-Life users. I already have a ton of info just waiting to be laid out on blogadollar. I loan because this venture started on may 5th 2007, 3 months ago but really starts to take off only 3 weeks now, because before, I was still having my 2nd semester exams. [I succeded an dgraduated from master 1 to master 2] It's also taking a lot of my time and requires hard work (I mean all day long). It's ok while it's the summer hollyday period. But I'm afraid not to be able to achieve my goals on time without more capital. The goal is to build the blog as much as possible and promote it as much as possible before september. (back to college time). When I'm back to college, I will still push blogadollar very hard and even harder and work very very hard of course, but it is obvious that it's best to do it now while I have all the time while it's summer's hollydays. Instead of having fun outside, like a lot of lucky 24 Year old youngs around, I'm on my desk working hard each and every day now, between my notebooks where I plan everything, and the computer connected to the Internet, where I apply everything I've planned from the notebooks. The notebooks are on topics like on-page optimisation, off-page optimisation, social networking, social bookmarking, blog promotion, internet marketing, taking action, daily tasks, progression status, web 2.0 etc etc... All of this is aimed to make blogadollar as successful and thriving as his counterparts who are earning $10,000 per month, while helping others acheve the same goal. This is a real win-win new venture. Now you know that I'm a 24 years old student, my background is that I'm skilled the most in computers and now in internet in this difficult to live world, and that's why I'm focusing highly on this venture. This is what I can do the best. I'm not best at anything else. So, I'll never let go, and need your help. Without your help, I'll continue and will succed anyway. With your help, I'll continue and succeed way way faster and help way way more people thriving with their home-biz too. This new venture has the huge potential to earn $10,000+ per month in a period as short as 6 to 8 months due to the ad revenue potential like it's other pairs on the market do enjoy already. And the market is wide open for anyone.
lender.occupational_info: - My aim is to work hard to make blogadollar.com the place that any little home-biz entrepreneur guy thinks of when he struggles getting his/her new web 2.0 generation blog/website to where he wants it to be. He/She wants a lot of traffic, a lot of visitors, a lot of page views, a lot of step by step, REAL step by step info about generating REAL web traffic and building momentum around their own website. - The goal is to show the little guy How to explode his traffic using precise, proven and tested through REAL-Life case studies techniques and methods and finally breathe new-life into their blog/website. - My job will be to boost their site from ‚Äúordinary‚Äù to extraordinary‚Ä¶ - To Show them How to quickly set up their Social Networking presence and avoid the mistakes most people make when they want to leverage their pages for business promotion -How to set their blog apart so it doesn‚Äôt look like a ‚Äúme too‚Äù and uses direct marketing principles that ‚Äúhook‚Äù their audience faster than a speeding Ferrari! -The steps for ‚Äúworking‚Äù your blog like a pro‚Ä¶ avoiding the classic mistakes rookies commit that keep their blogs working AGAINST them! And much much more. I need your help to achieve that faster. You can take a look at blogadollar by clicking this link: blogadollar.com

lender.name: Yan
lender.loan_because: I know what the struggles are like to set up your own business - I own a theatre company. In our more developed regions to get a loan, a so-called 'business loan', is as good as asking a blind man to give you directions. Whereas these people have the opportunity to achieve loans through the goodwill of people, avoiding all the financial assessment redtape. I hope that by giving my little every time, I am able to raise somebody's hopes, and who knows? My dollar could be the turning point of someone's life.
lender.occupational_info: Our company trains school students in drama and theatre productions. We also stage our own performances in community outreach programmes (eg. Climate change, anti-smoking, etc), as well as for corporate functions.
